definition: not plain, a kind of imagination that was held by Coleridge to be more casual and superficial than true imagination, imagine
details:
adjective
- not plain
noun
- a kind of imagination that was held by Coleridge to be more casual and superficial than true imagination
- something many people believe that is false
= synonyms: illusion
- a predisposition to like something
= synonyms: fondness, partiality
verb
- imagine
= synonyms: figure
- have a fancy or particular liking or desire for
= synonyms: go for, take to
